alert.note: Alert for Harper; Harvey; Kingman; McPherson; Reno; Rice; Sedgwick; Sumner (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 1:48PM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of McPherson, eastern Reno, western Sedgwick, western Harvey, eastern Harper, southeastern Rice, eastern Kingman and western Sumner Counties through 300 PM CDT... At 146 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles south of Windom to near Harper. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds up to 40 mph, torrential rainfall, and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor street flooding is also possible due to brief torrential rainfall. Locations impacted include... Wichita, Hutchinson, Mcpherson, Goddard, Hesston, Lindsborg, Maize, Clearwater, South Hutchinson, Anthony, Cheney, Halstead, Moundridge, Sedgwick, Harper, Inman, Colwich, Buhler, Conway Springs and Haven. This includes Interstate 135 between Mile Markers 42 and 76. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Harper; Harvey; Kingman; McPherson; Reno; Rice; Sedgwick; Sumner
